title: Member FAQ - Greater Springfield Board of Realtors

contentTree.content:
Member FAQ

Check out the list of frequently asked questions below. If you can’t find the answer to your question, fill out the contact form and we’ll get back with you as soon as possible.

MEMBERSHIP FAQ
What fees are associated with membership?
Board dues
MLS fees
Equipment fees (lockbox and key)

Dues Calculator

How do I cancel my membership?
Can I put my membership on hold?
I’ve moved my license to a different broker. How do I get this updated at the Board?
How and where can I renew my board dues?
When and how are renewal invoices sent?
I’ve hired an unlicensed assistant what do I need to do to get MLS access?
I work on a team, do all team members need to join?
Can I share my member/MLS login with my assistant?
If I renew my membership and end up needing to cancel, will I receive a refund?
Can't Find the Answer to Your Question?

Fill out a contact form, email or call. One of our friendly staff members would be happy to answer your question.

CONTACT US

Agents cannot cancel membership without written instruction from the broker. Your broker will need to send an email to support@gsbor.com and include a copy of the MREC form or written instruction to cancel.
children.html: Agents cannot cancel membership without written instruction from the broker. Your broker will need to send an email to support@gsbor.com and include a copy of the MREC form or written instruction to cancel.

children.content: Agents cannot cancel membership without written instruction from the broker. Your broker will need to send an email to support@gsbor.com and include a copy of the MREC form or written instruction to cancel.
There is not an option to put a membership on hold. You can only join or cancel your membership.
children.html: There is not an option to put a membership on hold. You can only join or cancel your membership.

children.content: There is not an option to put a membership on hold. You can only join or cancel your membership.

Your broker will need to submit a copy of the MREC license change form to the Board AFTER it has been sent certified mail to MREC. MREC will charge a $50.00 license change fee that will need to accompany the license. The Board also charges a $50.00 transfer fee to update all your member/MLS records. Please make sure to notify the board of additional contact information changes such as name, address, phone or email address.

Please make sure to notify the board of additional contact information changes such as name, address, phone or email address.
Update Information

children.content: Update Information
You can pay your dues online through the “pay bill” option. Please note: Payments must BE MADE by January 31st to avoid the $50.00 late fee.
children.html: You can pay your dues online through the “pay bill” option. Please note: Payments must BE MADE by January 31st to avoid the $50.00 late fee.

children.content: You can pay your dues online through the “pay bill” option. Please note: Payments must BE MADE by January 31st to avoid the $50.00 late fee.
Renewal invoices are posted online to your GSBOR account. The first notice will go out in mid-December. Dues are payable as of January 1st and late as of February 1st.
children.html: Renewal invoices are posted online to your GSBOR account. The first notice will go out in mid-December. Dues are payable as of January 1st and late as of February 1st.

children.content: Renewal invoices are posted online to your GSBOR account. The first notice will go out in mid-December. Dues are payable as of January 1st and late as of February 1st.
Teams are created under the direction of your Designated Broker and do not factor into Board membership. This means there is not a “team” membership option; it is only on an individual basis.
children.html: Teams are created under the direction of your Designated Broker and do not factor into Board membership. This means there is not a “team” membership option; it is only on an individual basis.

children.content: Teams are created under the direction of your Designated Broker and do not factor into Board membership. This means there is not a “team” membership option; it is only on an individual basis.
No, sharing of any login credentials between members is strictly prohibited.
children.html: No, sharing of any login credentials between members is strictly prohibited.

children.content: No, sharing of any login credentials between members is strictly prohibited.
No, there are no refunds on Board dues and application fees.

Web Accessibility
children.html: Web Accessibility

children.content: Web Accessibility

Greater Springfield Board of Realtors®, Inc. is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually improving the user experience for everyone and applying relevant accessibility standards.

If you have difficulty accessing content, have difficulty viewing a file on the website, or notice any accessibility problems, please contact us to specify the nature of the accessibility issue and any assistive technology you use. We will strive to provide the content you need in the format you require.

contentTree.html:
Member FAQ

Check out the list of frequently asked questions below. If you can’t find the answer to your question, fill out the contact form and we’ll get back with you as soon as possible.

MEMBERSHIP FAQ

What fees are associated with membership?
  1. Board dues
  2. MLS fees
  3. Equipment fees (lockbox and key)

Dues Calculator

How do I cancel my membership?

Agents cannot cancel membership without written instruction from the broker. Your broker will need to send an email to support@gsbor.com and include a copy of the MREC form or written instruction to cancel.

Can I put my membership on hold?

There is not an option to put a membership on hold. You can only join or cancel your membership.

I’ve moved my license to a different broker. How do I get this updated at the Board?

Your broker will need to submit a copy of the MREC license change form to the Board AFTER it has been sent certified mail to MREC. MREC will charge a $50.00 license change fee that will need to accompany the license. The Board also charges a $50.00 transfer fee to update all your member/MLS records. Please make sure to notify the board of additional contact information changes such as name, address, phone or email address.

Update Information 

How and where can I renew my board dues?

You can pay your dues online through the “pay bill” option. Please note: Payments must BE MADE by January 31st to avoid the $50.00 late fee.

When and how are renewal invoices sent?

Renewal invoices are posted online to your GSBOR account. The first notice will go out in mid-December. Dues are payable as of January 1st and late as of February 1st.

I’ve hired an unlicensed assistant what do I need to do to get MLS access?
    1. You will need to request an Admin Application by emailing support@gsbor.com.
    2. The application requires a broker signature.
    3. There is a monthly MLS Admin fee of $25.00 each month.
I work on a team, do all team members need to join?

Teams are created under the direction of your Designated Broker and do not factor into Board membership. This means there is not a “team” membership option; it is only on an individual basis.

Can I share my member/MLS login with my assistant?

No, sharing of any login credentials between members is strictly prohibited.

If I renew my membership and end up needing to cancel, will I receive a refund?

No, there are no refunds on Board dues and application fees.

Can't Find the Answer to Your Question?

Fill out a contact form, email or call. One of our friendly staff members would be happy to answer your question.

Contact Us
